abstract: Dutch Finance Min Jeroen Dijsselbloem says government will reconsider selling off bank ABN Amro; senior managers will give up raises, clearing way for initial public offering.
lead_paragraph: The Dutch finance minister had held up the state-owned lender’s privatization after planned pay increases provoked public outcry.

headline.main: After ABN Amro Forgoes Raises, I.P.O. May Go Ahead
headline.print_headline: ABN Amro Halts Raises, Clearing Barrier to I.P.O.

snippet: The Dutch finance minister had held up the state-owned lender’s privatization after planned pay increases provoked public outcry.
